WordPress Glossary

The A-Zs of WordPress

The A-Zs of the WordPress

Memory Usage

Memory usage in Wordpress refers to the amount of RAM that the platform consumes while running, which can impact website performance and scalability.

Meta Box

Meta Box is a powerful WordPress plugin that allows developers to easily create custom meta boxes and fields for posts, pages, and custom post types.

Metadata

Metadata in Wordpress refers to additional information about a post or page, such as the author, date, tags, and categories, that is stored in the database and used to organize and display content on the website.

Method

Method is a PHP library that provides a simple and consistent way to make HTTP requests and handle responses in WordPress.

Multisite Network

Multisite Network is a feature in WordPress that allows a single installation to host multiple sites, each with its own unique domain or subdomain, content, and users.

Multisite

Multisite (MU) is a feature in WordPress that allows users to create and manage multiple websites from a single WordPress installation.

MySQL

MySQL is a relational database management system used by WordPress to store and retrieve data for websites and applications.

Navigation Bar

A Navigation Bar is a graphical user interface element that displays a list of links to different pages or sections of a website, typically located at the top of a WordPress website.

Navigation Menu

A navigation menu in Wordpress is a user interface element that displays a list of links to different pages or sections of a website, allowing users to easily navigate and access content.

Nonce Keys

Nonce keys are randomly generated strings used to ensure the security of form submissions and prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data in Wordpress.
